SPScript Docs
Class: RestDao

RestDao

new RestDao(urlopt)

Main point of entry. Big Daddy class that all SP requests are routed through. Data Access Object (DAO)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
url string <optional>
 Url of the site you are connected to. _spPageContextInfo.webAbsoluteUrl will be used if no value is passed.
Properties:
Name Type Description
webUrl string Url of the site you are connected to
web Web Allows interacting with the SharePoint site you connected to
search Search Allows querying through the SP Search Service
profiles Profiles Allows interacting with the SP Profile Service
Source:
  • restDao.js, line 17
Example

Create a new instance of a RestDao

var dao = new SPScript.RestDao(_spPageContextInfo.webAbsoluteUrl);

Extends

  • BaseDao

Methods

get(relativeQueryUrl, extendedOptionsopt) → {Promise}

Generic helper to make AJAX GET request
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
relativeQueryUrl string the API url relative to "/_api"
extendedOptions Object <optional>
 AJAX options (like custom request headers)
Inherited From:
  • BaseDao#get
Source:
  • baseDao.js, line 34
Returns:
- An ES6 Promise that resolves to the an object probably in the form of data.d
Type
Promise
Example

Use generic GET method to retrieve a site's content types

dao.get('/web/contentTypes').then(function(data) { console.log(data.d.results)})

lists(listnameopt) → {List|Promise}

If a list name is passed, an SPScript.List object, otherwise performs a request to get all the site's lists
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
listname string <optional>
 If a list name is passed, method is synchronous returning an SPScript.List
Inherited From:
  • BaseDao#lists
Source:
  • baseDao.js, line 54
Returns:
- SPScript.List object or a Promise that resolves to an Array of lists
Type
List | Promise
Examples

Option 1: No List Name gets all the lists of a site

dao.lists().then(function(lists) { console.log(lists)});

Option 2: Pass a List Name to get a list object

var list = dao.lists('MyList');
list.getItemById(12).then(function(item) { console.log(item)});
